text: One confidential evening, not three months ago, Lionel Wallace told
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: me this story of the Door in the Wall.  And at the time I thought
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: that so far as he was concerned it was a true story.
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: He told it me with such a direct simplicity of conviction that
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: I could not do otherwise than believe in him.  But in the morning,
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: in my own flat, I woke to a different atmosphere, and as I lay in
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: bed and recalled the things he had told me, stripped of the glamour
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: of his earnest slow voice, denuded of the focussed shaded table
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: light, the shadowy atmosphere that wrapped about him and the
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: pleasant bright things, the dessert and glasses and napery of the
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: dinner we had shared, making them for the time a bright little
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: world quite cut off from every-day realities, I saw it all as
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: frankly incredible.  "He was mystifying!" I said, and then: "How
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: well he did it!. . . . .  It isn't quite the thing I should have
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: expected him, of all people, to do well."
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: Afterwards, as I sat up in bed and sipped my morning tea, I
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: found myself trying to account for the flavour of reality that
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: perplexed me in his impossible reminiscences, by supposing they did
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: in some way suggest, present, convey--I hardly know which word to
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: use--experiences it was otherwise impossible to tell.
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: Well, I don't resort to that explanation now.  I have got over
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: my intervening doubts.  I believe now, as I believed at the moment
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: of telling, that Wallace did to the very best of his ability strip
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: the truth of his secret for me.  But whether he himself saw, or
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: only thought he saw, whether he himself was the possessor of an
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: inestimable privilege, or the victim of a fantastic dream, I cannot
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: pretend to guess.  Even the facts of his death, which ended my
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: doubts forever, throw no light on that.  That much the reader must
title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

text: judge for himself.

author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

author: Wells, H. G. (Herbert George)

title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories

title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories

title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories

title: The Door in the Wall, and Other Stories
